meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an illusion
meanings.sent1: The magician's illusionistic tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The painting had an illusionistic effect, making it seem like the flowers were real.
meanings.sent3: The illusionistic mirror made the room look much bigger than it actually was.
meanings.sent4: Her illusionistic smile hid the sadness she felt inside.
meanings.sent5: The illusionistic sunset painted the sky in vibrant colors.

meanings.sent1: The illusionistic lighting transformed the stage into a mystical forest.
meanings.sent2: The artist used illusionistic techniques to make the sculpture appear lifelike.
meanings.sent3: The illusionistic sound effects made the movie even more thrilling.
meanings.sent4: His illusionistic words painted a picture of a world beyond imagination.
meanings.sent5: The illusionistic performance left the audience in awe of the magic.

meanings.sent1: The illusionistic world of dreams felt both real and surreal.
meanings.sent2: The illusionistic nature of the mind can sometimes deceive us.
meanings.sent3: The illusionistic nature of the maze made it challenging to find the way out.
meanings.sent4: Her illusionistic thoughts created a fantasy world in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The illusionistic atmosphere of the carnival was filled with wonder and mystery.
